title: Font - Rashomon
content:
Hi everybody,

Does anyone know the name of the two typefaces used on this movie poster ?

Thank you for your help !

Tristan

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635im_/http:/typophile.com/files/81nFDiYfcbL_6311._SL1500_.jpg)

Font: 

 Aardvark, Block Gothic, Frutiger 

Solved By: 

 [bowfinpw](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635/http:/typophile.com/user/2088 "View user profile.")
author: Tristan Isaac

comments.content:
RASHOMON looks like an adaptation of Font Bureau [Aardvark](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/aardvark/?refby=bowfin). The A and H have been changed to have normal crossbars, but otherwise this seems like the source (or inspiration) for this lettering.

- Mike Yanega

There are two different sans serif fonts used on the poster but the red lettering looks a lot like [Block Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/block-gothic-rr/?refby=bowfin) from Red Rooster. A little height/width tweaking seems like it would match very well.

The gold sans at the top is something else that looks commonplace.

- Mike Yanega

The gold sans is [Univers](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/univers/), by Adrian Frutiger. Available from Linotype and Adobe. Best match is probably the Black (75) weight.
Osamu, that gold lettering is <cite>not</cite> Univers. The /S and the /C are the first indications.
George, you're right. I completely skipped the word OSCAR and was was looking at some other features. My apologies for jumping the gun.

Osamu, I think you had the right designer, just the wrong typeface. I think it's [Frutiger](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701122635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/frutiger/?refby=bowfin).

- Mike Yanega
These are the ones I was looking for. Thanks a lot to all three of you !
